version_description:
• Organize your library with the new nested sublists feature! This app update adds sublists display - any sublists created in the desktop app will automatically sync over (creating sublists in the mobile app is coming in a future update)
• Updated institutional proxy list
• We love feedback from our users - please email support@readcube.com with any questions or issues.

Thanks for using ReadCube!

• Fixed a bug with annotation saving
• Fixed a bug with the PDF Notes editor box
• Added last author sort and fixed an issue with sorting by last name
• Improved searching within PDFs
• Improvements to sync
• And the ever mysterious "general bug fixes and performance improvements"
• We love feedback from our users - email us at support@readcube.com
with any questions or comments

• Nested lists can now be collapsed - double tap to open and close folders in the left navigation menu
• List collapse states will be remembered between app sessions
• Improved automatic identification of imported PDFs
• Improved PDF Enhancement process
• Improved library proxy downloads from Google Scholar search
• Changed how PDFs are closed or kept open - close an article by tapping the Close button in the PDF viewer or keep it open in the left menu by simply navigating somewhere else in the app
• Fixed a bug where the keyboard sometimes covers a Note input box
• Fixed an issue with library proxy cookies
• Fixed an issue that sometimes prevented eLife downloads
• Improved syncing and display of sync progress
• Squashed misc. bugs + general performance improvements

We love feedback from our users - email us at support@readcube.com with any questions or comments

• Nested sublists can now be created in the app and will sync to the other ReadCube apps, including the desktop software - just tap the + button at the bottom of the left menu panel
• Improved app stability
• Improved display of unidentified PDFs in your library
• Fixed a bug with display rotation
• Fixed a bug that could cause the keyboard to disappear while writing notes
• Other misc. bug fixes

• We love feedback from our users - email us at support@readcube.com with any questions or comments

• New Pro feature: (hash)tagging - add one or more #tags to the Notes section of references (under the abstract)
• Access #tagged references quickly with the new Tags lists in the left menu panel
• Sync your #tags to/from the desktop app
• New Unsorted list in the left menu panel - quickly see the references that do not belong to any list(s)
• Spotlight search integration - quickly search your reference library from the system Spotlight and jump directly to any paper
• Annotations and notes are now included in library searches
• Fixed a bug that prevented automatic supplement attachment to downloaded articles
• Improved hiding/showing of the search bar when scrolling your library on iPhone devices
• Improved annotation/note syncing to your other ReadCube apps
• iOS 9 and iPad Pro ready
• Bug fixes and various other improvements under the hood
• We love feedback from our users - email us at support@readcube.com with any questions or comments

• Under-the-hood maintenance update to fix a few bugs (see prev. release notes for the newest features in the last major update)
• Fixed a bug with importing PDFs from other apps (using “Copy to” or “Open in” ReadCube)
• Fixed an app crashing bug
• We’re always working to improve the app! Please email us at support@readcube.com with any feedback or questions

v2.01 minor bug fix update - addresses potential crash issue for iOS7 devices
• New for ReadCube Teams - download and read articles from shared group libraries
• New - “Notes” filter in library searches, to filter for just your annotations
• New - added article options for manually-created references (Favorite, View and Download from Web)
• Fixed - nesting a list under an existing list
• Fixed - open PDFs not being listed on iPhones
• Fixed - removal of empty hashtags
• Fixed - manual downloading of supplements
• Fixed - display of nested sublist references in the parent list
• Fixed - setting of future dates for manual reference creation/editing
• Fixed - library filtering articles in the cloud
• Improved automatic PDF downloads from web
• Improved inline citation Enhancements in PDF viewer
• Misc. bug fixes
• Under-the-hood improvements to app performance

• Fixed - newly created sublist not displayed in the menu panel
• Fixed - not being able to edit Notes after adding a new #tag
• Fixed - incorrect display of a new #tag list when created via editing an existing #tag
• Improved automatic PDF downloads from search results (when available)
• Improved display of long article names
• Added support for navigating to #tags lists from article Notes in shared libraries
• Other performance improvements and fixes

• New - select multiple references for batch actions. Swipe right in your library to display the selection flags, swipe left to hide
• Improved the Share extension for sending links from other apps - find imported webpages in the left menu panel; save as webpage references or navigate to PDFs to automatically import
• Improved syncing of institutional proxy settings with your web account (readcube.com/account)
• Fixed - issues with hashtag navigation
• Fixed - occasional issues with downloading of supplements
• Fixed - Remove from List action displays the wrong list name
• Fixed - metadata display after a manual edit
• Other under the hood fixes and improvements

• Improved and fixed issues with the Google login option - the login form is now presented in an integrated browser window for improved compatibility
• Fixed - rare library sync problems
• Other under the hood fixes and improvements

• Compatibility fixes for iOS 11
• Compatibility fixes for iPhone X
• Improves sync performance and fixes sync-related crashes
• Fixes issues with supplements downloading, for purchased and manual references
• Other misc fixes and improvements
• New requirement: minimum iOS version 9

• Fixed issue with highlight annotation selection
• Improved searching for Enhanced Citations in PDFs
• Display optimizations for iPhone X

• Fixed issues with login
• Additional optimizations for iPhone X
• General optimizations and bug fixes

* Improved PDF rendering performance
* Improved 1-click PDF downloading behavior from various publisher websites
* General stability improvements and bug fixes
* Fixes crashing issue on iOS 9 when viewing PDFs.

* Improvements and bug fixes for sync
* Improved annotation merging
* Improved freehand drawing
* Fixes to ezproxy integration
* Other bug fixes and performance improvements
* Resolves issues with PDF downloading
* Improvements to annotation merging logic.

* Fixes issues with sublists lists in library
* Resolves issues with menu rotation
* General optimizations and bug fixes

Fixes issues with PDF search not working properly.
Fixes annotation issues, including Apple Pencil improvements.
Fixes for author affiliation rendering.
Fixes to scrolling reference lists.

• Dark mode is here! Enable it by toggling your IOS preferences
• Added tags into the app
• New PSPDFKit for better rendering and PDF improvements
• Settings screen has gotten a minor update
• Allow reading from PDF using IPhone text to speech
• Squashed bugs and improved performance

* App version will now show on settings menu
* Minor Dark mode improvements
* Squashed bugs & Improved Performance

* Tags will now show properly
* MIT Proxy fix
* Fixed minor bug with other proxies

* Support for new highlight colors from web
* Free PDFs from PMC support
* Fixed issue with selection border not being removed

* Fixed issue with supplements
* Improved Sync to desktop and web app

* Fixed issue with highlights on certain PDFs
* Improved syncing of shared libraries
